abstract: Background: To support vaccination programs in developing countries, a 4-dose vial presentation of pneumococcal non-typeable Haemophilus influenzae protein D-conjugate vaccine (PHiD-CV) was developed. This study assessed immunologic non-inferiority and safety of the investigational PHiD-CV 4-dose versus licensed 1-dose vial presentation in infants. Methods: In this phase III, mono-center, observer-blind study in Bangladesh, 6–10-week-old infants were randomized 1:1 to receive PHiD-CV primary vaccination (at ages 6, 10, 18 weeks) and a booster dose (at age 9 months) with a 4-dose vial (with preservative, 4DV group) or 1-dose vial (preservative-free, 1DV group). DTPw-HBV/Hib was (co)-administered per study protocol and polio, measles and rubella vaccines as part of the national immunization program. Non-inferiority of PHiD-CV 4-dose versus 1-dose vial for each vaccine pneumococcal serotype (VT) and vaccine-related serotype 19A in terms of antibody geometric mean concentration (GMC) was assessed (criterion: upper limit of 2-sided 95% confidence interval of antibody GMC ratios [1DV/4DV] <2-fold). Immune responses were measured. Solicited, unsolicited and serious adverse events (AEs) were evaluated. Results: Of 320 infants (160 per group) vaccinated during the primary vaccination phase, 297 received a booster. Non-inferiority was demonstrated for each VT and 19A. One month post-primary vaccination, for most VT, ≥97.9% of infants in each group had antibody concentrations ≥0.2 μg/mL; for 19A ≥ 80.1% reached this threshold. Pneumococcal antibody responses and opsonophagocytic activity for each VT and 19A were within similar ranges between groups after primary and booster vaccination, as were anti-protein D responses. Booster immune responses were observed in both groups. Reported AEs were within similar ranges for both presentations. Conclusion: Immunologic non-inferiority of PHiD-CV 4-dose vial (with preservative) versus PHiD-CV 1-dose vial (preservative-free) was demonstrated. Immune responses and reactogenicity following primary/booster vaccination were within similar ranges for both presentations. PHiD-CV 4-dose vial would help improve access and coverage in resource-limited countries. Clinical Trial Registry: NCT02447432.

body_text.sentence: A total of 320 infants were planned to be enrolled, considering that up to 12.5% could be eliminated from the according-to-protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity.
body_text.title: Statistical analyses

body_text.sentence: In total, 320 infants were enrolled.
body_text.title: Study population

body_text.sentence: One month post-booster, at least 90.5% of infants had OPA titers ≥8 for each VT.
body_text.title: Booster vaccination phase

body_text.sentence: In addition, this study also assessed immunogenicity of the PHiD-CV 4-dose in terms of percentage of infants with antibody concentrations ≥0.2 µg/mL, percentage of infants with OPA titers ≥8 and OPA GMTs 1 month post-primary vaccination, following WHO recommendations [22].
body_text.title: Discussion

body_text.sentence: At study end, we have recorded a maximum time after opening and until use of the last vial-dose of 23 days, which is close to the WHO allowed maximum after opening.
body_text.title: Discussion

body_text.sentence: GlaxoSmithKline Biologicals SA was the funding source and was involved in all stages of the study conduct and analysis.
body_text.title: Funding

body_text.sentence: No large swelling reactions were reported.
body_text.title: Booster vaccination phase

body_text.sentence: The 2-fold non-inferiority margin for the antibody GMC ratio was chosen because different PHiD-CV lots were previously shown to be within a 2-fold range [23].
body_text.title: Discussion

body_text.sentence: The percentages of infants reaching pre-defined immunologic cut-offs, antibody GMCs and OPA geometric mean titers (GMTs) were calculated with 95% confidence intervals (CIs).
body_text.title: Statistical analyses

body_text.sentence: No safety concerns were raised.
body_text.title: Discussion

body_text.sentence: A resulting 140 evaluable infants per group would provide at least 90.8% power (under equal mean) to show non-inferiority of PHiD-CV 4-dose vial versus PHiD-CV 1-dose vial in terms of antibody GMC ratios.
body_text.title: Statistical analyses

body_text.sentence: In addition, as outlined in the WHO multi-dose vial policy and as required for WHO prequalification [14], the time limit for keeping the opened 4-dose vial with preservative was 28 days per protocol.
body_text.title: Discussion

body_text.sentence: PHiD-CV is administered in Bangladesh per local EPI schedule for pneumococcal vaccination at 6–10–18 weeks [32].
body_text.title: Discussion

body_text.sentence: The previously licensed 2-dose vial improves logistics (delivery, storage and cold chain capacity) compared to the 1-dose vial.
body_text.title: Introduction

body_text.sentence: Children received diphtheria-tetanus-whole cell pertussis-hepatitis B and H. influenzae type b conjugate vaccine (DTPw-HBV/Hib, GSK) and polio, measles and rubella vaccines as described in Fig. S1.
body_text.title: Study design and population

body_text.sentence: The percentage of infants with OPA titers ≥8 was at least 83.8% for each VT, and at least 54.5% and 80.6% for vaccine-related serotypes 6A and 19A.
body_text.title: Primary vaccination phase

body_text.sentence: Except for the confirmatory objectives related to immunologic non-inferiority, the other study objectives were descriptive.
body_text.title: Statistical analyses

body_text.sentence: Causality of all other AEs was assessed by the investigators.
body_text.title: Reactogenicity and safety assessment

body_text.sentence: Solicited general AEs considered by the investigator as vaccination-related were reported after less than 23.3% (irritability) of doses in the 4DV group, and after less than 26.6% (irritability) of doses in the 1DV group.
body_text.title: Primary vaccination phase

body_text.sentence: AE intensity grades and SAE definitions are detailed in supplementary text S3.
body_text.title: Reactogenicity and safety assessment

body_text.sentence: Serotype-specific antibody GMCs were within similar ranges between groups (Table 2).
body_text.title: Primary vaccination phase

body_text.sentence: Each vial dose from the PHiD-CV 4-dose presentation was evenly repartitioned between consecutive vaccinations (Table S1).
body_text.title: Use of the PHiD-CV 4-dose vial

keywords: Pneumococcal non-typeable Haemophilus influenzae protein D-conjugate vaccine (PHiD-CV)
metadata.title: Immunologic non-inferiority and safety of the investigational pneumococcal non-typeable Haemophilus influenzae protein D-conjugate vaccine (PHiD-CV) 4-dose vial presentation compared to the licensed PHiD-CV 1-dose vial presentation in infants: A phase III randomized study
